decks.notes: This deck revolves around utilizing low-cost, evasive creatures combined with disruptive counter spells to control the board while applying pressure to the opponent. By deploying inexpensive threats with abilities such as unblockable or flying, it aims to quickly amass card advantage through Edric, Spymaster of Trest's ability, drawing additional cards when dealing combat damage. The deck also includes powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Swords to enhance its creatures in combat. With a mix of efficient removal, countermagic, card draw, and mana ramp, this aggressive strategy seeks to overwhelm opponents with a relentless onslaught of creatures while maintaining control over the pace of the game.

The deck revolves around utilizing Niv-Mizzet Reborn as the commander to control the game by having a diverse range of multicolored cards that cover various aspects of control, such as removal, counterspells, and card advantage. The deck includes a mix of lands that provide all the necessary colors to cast the commander and other spells efficiently. It also features versatile cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Thought Erasure to disrupt opponents' strategies. The key strategy is to leverage the card draw potential of Niv-Mizzet Reborn to consistently find answers and threats, while maintaining control of the game through a combination of removal, counterspells, and efficient mana management.

The main concept of this deck is to take advantage of The Gitrog Monster's ability to draw cards by sacrificing lands, combined with various land-based synergies and tutors to assemble a powerful combo win condition. By utilizing cards like Life from the Loam, Crucible of Worlds, and Ramunap Excavator to repeatedly bring back lands from the graveyard, the deck can create a loop where lands are sacrificed to draw cards and generate mana. This can lead to explosive plays and enable the deck to quickly assemble key pieces like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token and win the game. The deck focuses on efficient mana ramp, disruption, and card advantage to set up and protect its combo finish.

The deck is focused on ramping up quickly and effectively using cards like Lotus Cobra, Utopia Sprawl, and Cultivate to accelerate mana production. It aims to control the board with removal spells like All Is Dust and Warping Wail, while also utilizing powerful creatures such as Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Emrakul, the Promised End to dominate the battlefield. Nissa, Vastwood Seer serves as the commander, providing card advantage and a late-game threat when transformed. The deck also includes utility lands like Glacial Chasm and Dark Depths to protect against aggressive strategies, as well as tutoring effects like Expedition Map and Sylvan Scrying to find key pieces like Eldrazi Temple and Eye of Ugin.

This deck focuses on a versatile and aggressive playstyle, utilizing a mix of powerful artifacts, removal spells, and card advantage engines to control the board and pressure opponents. The Partner commanders provide flexibility and synergy, allowing for various strategies and lines of play. By combining the artifact synergy of Breya, Etherium Shaper with the aggro potential of Akiri, Line-Slinger, the deck can adapt to different situations and take advantage of the opponent's weaknesses. With a strong mana base and a variety of efficient threats, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain board presence throughout the game, ultimately overwhelming the opponent and securing victory.

This deck focuses on combining artifact synergies with aggressive strategies in a competitive 1 vs 1 format. The commanders, Akiri, Line-Slinger and Silas Renn, Seeker Adept, provide a strong balance of combat abilities and card advantage. The deck includes a wide range of powerful artifacts, removal spells, and card draw engines to ensure consistent pressure on the opponent. With a mix of fast mana rocks and efficient threats, the deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up for powerful plays with cards like Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas and Breya, Etherium Shaper. By leveraging the partner mechanic and a versatile card pool, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory through aggressive and efficient play.

The main focus of this control deck is to effectively control the board through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and versatile creatures. With Niv-Mizzet Reborn as the commander, the deck aims to take advantage of his ability to draw cards and generate card advantage by playing a diverse array of multicolored cards. By utilizing a mix of removal, card draw, and counter magic, the deck can disrupt opponents' strategies while steadily building its own resources. The mana base is designed to support the deck's multicolored requirements, allowing for flexibility in casting spells of various colors. Overall, the key strategy is to outvalue opponents by efficiently controlling the game and generating incremental advantage.

The deck revolves around generating and sacrificing tokens to create a large amount of mana and then utilizing that mana to cast powerful spells, such as Prossh, Skyraider of Kher, and Purphoros, God of the Forge. The deck also includes various tutors and combo pieces to help assemble its win condition quickly. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with an army of creatures and burn effects, ultimately leading to a combo finish or overwhelming the opponent with sheer board presence. The deck is designed to be fast-paced and aggressive, aiming to win the game as quickly as possible through a powerful combo.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful control spells, card advantage engines, and disruptive creatures to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents. Aminatou, the Fateshifter serves as the commander, providing additional utility and card selection. The deck focuses on utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to control the board state and slow down opponents. The deck also includes cards like Demonic Tutor and Enlightened Tutor to find key pieces and win conditions, such as Entreat the Angels and True-Name Nemesis. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies and maintain control of the game until it can secure a victory.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced aggressive strategy centered around the legendary creature Isamaru, Hound of Konda. The deck includes a variety of low-cost creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. It also features a strong suite of support cards, including removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and efficient beaters like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar. The deck aims to establish early board presence, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and close out the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize. With a mix of creature threats, disruptive elements, and removal spells, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent in a 1 vs 1 Duel Commander format.

This aggro deck revolves around Kari Zev, Skyship Raider as the commander and focuses on dealing fast and consistent damage to the opponent. The deck is filled with low-cost, efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures to apply pressure early on. Cards like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Flame Javelin are used to target the opponent directly, while creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Hell's Thunder help to chip away at the opponent's life total. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly, utilizing cards like Firebrand Archer and Incendiary Flow to maintain a steady stream of damage. Overall, the key concept is to be fast and relentless in dealing damage to secure a win before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a wide variety of spells and removal options in order to disrupt the opponent's strategy and keep them on the defensive. With Niv-Mizzet Reborn as the commander, the deck aims to have access to a diverse array of multicolored spells that can provide answers to any situation. By incorporating cards such as Countersquall, Detention Sphere, and Vindicate, the deck can handle threats efficiently while also maintaining card advantage through cards like Diabolic Vision and Brainstorm. Additionally, the deck includes a mix of creatures and planeswalkers to apply pressure and close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana and create a large number of creatures, then utilize Prossh, Skyraider of Kher's ability to sacrifice those creatures for more tokens and pump up Prossh himself. This deck focuses on assembling various combo pieces and utilizing cards like Earthcraft, Fecundity, and Goblin Bombardment to generate a massive amount of value and overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes a mix of mana ramp, card draw, and removal spells to ensure consistency and resilience. By combining mana acceleration, creature generation, and sacrifice outlets, this deck aims to create a powerful board state and close out the game quickly before the opponent can respond effectively.

The key concept of this deck is a control strategy centered around Queen Marchesa as the commander. The deck aims to control the game through a variety of removal spells like Abrade, Anguished Unmaking, and Terminate, along with board wipes such as Anger of the Gods and Wrath of God. It also includes disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck utilizes Queen Marchesa's monarch ability to generate card advantage and maintain control of the game. Additionally, the deck includes a range of planeswalkers like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Liliana of the Veil to provide added value and control the board.

The key concept of this deck revolves around the commander, Sram, Senior Edificer, and the strategy of playing low-cost artifacts and enchantments. The deck focuses on playing a wide range of equipment and auras that provide various benefits, such as increasing power and toughness, granting protection, or providing card draw. It also includes creatures with abilities like protection or the ability to tap for additional mana. This deck aims to maintain a low curve with efficient threats and disruption, using cards like Aven Mindcensor, Phyrexian Revoker, and Swords to Plowshares to control the board. It also includes powerful card draw engines like Kor Spiritdancer and Skullclamp to generate advantage and overwhelm opponents.

The focus of this deck is on using the Partner commanders Thrasios, Triton Hero and Tymna the Weaver to quickly establish a board presence and overwhelm the opponent. The deck is designed to be aggressive, utilizing a wide range of creatures and spells to generate advantage and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a strong mana base and access to powerful cards like Demonic Tutor and Enlightened Tutor, the deck aims to consistently apply pressure and control the game tempo. By combining card advantage with efficient threats, the deck seeks to outpace the opponent and secure a commanding position on the battlefield.
